comments: f X_1,X_2,...,X_n is a partition of a 3n-set X into 3-blocks then, for n>0, a(n) is equal to the number of (n+1)-subsets of X intersecting each X_i (i=1,2,...,n). - _Milan Janjic_, Jul 21 2007.Sum(n>=1, 1/a(n) ) = log(3/2) = 0.405465108... = A016578. - _Franz Vrabec_, Jan 07 2012

formula: A trinomial transform. Differentiate (1+x+x^2)^n and set x=1. a(n)=sum{i=0..n, sum{j=0..n, (2n-2i-j)*n!/(i!j!(n-i-j)!)}} - _Paul Barry_, Feb 06 2004a(n)=sum{k=0..2n, T(n, k)*k}, where T(n, k) is given by A027907; a(n)=sum{k=0..n, sum{j=0..n, C(n, j)C(j, k)(j+k)}}. - _Paul Barry_, Feb 15 2005G.f. 3*x / (3*x-1)^2 . a(n) = 3*A027471(n+1). - _R.
